ja13:1.1: A naive mountain buck falls for a doe experienced in the ways of men. When the path grows dangerous, she lets him lead the way, so that he falls to the arrow.
ja13:1.5: _Dikkhitā_ (“cursed”) is a word of unique occurrence in Pali. It is from the same root as the more common imprecation _dhiratthu_ (“cursed be!”). Both are glossed with _√garah_.
